snippet: Last season, only half of the 32 N.F.L. teams used the same starting quarterback in all 16 regular-season games. And the teams with quarterback problems often seem to have them year after year.
abstract: Starting quarterback is arguably most important job in NFL football, but teams must ensure backups can get job done if starter falters or is injured.
lead_paragraph: Last season, only half of the 32 N.F.L. teams used the same starting quarterback in all 16 regular-season games. And the teams with quarterback problems often seem to have them year after year.

headline.main: From Holding a Clipboard to Carrying a Franchise’s Hopes
headline.print_headline: From Holding a Clipboard to Carrying a Franchise’s Hopes
